title: Get a list of train stations
description: Returns a paginated and searchable list of all train stations.

tabs.title: shell
tabs.code:
curl --request GET \
     --url 'https://try.microcks.io/rest/Train+Travel+API/1.0.0/stations?page=1&limit=10&coordinates=52.5200%2C13.4050&search=Milano%20Centrale&country=DE' \
     --header 'accept: application/json'

tabs.title: javascript
python
tabs.code:
import requests

url = "https://try.microcks.io/rest/Train+Travel+API/1.0.0/stations?page=1&limit=10&coordinates=52.5200%2C13.4050&search=Milano%20Centrale&country=DE"

headers = {"accept": "application/json"}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

print(response.text)

tabs.title: go
tabs.code:
package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"net/http"
	"io"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://try.microcks.io/rest/Train+Travel+API/1.0.0/stations?page=1&limit=10&coordinates=52.5200%2C13.4050&search=Milano%20Centrale&country=DE"

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("GET", url, nil)

	req.Header.Add("accept", "application/json")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := io.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

title: Get available train trips
description: Returns a list of available train trips between the specified origin and destination stations on the given date, and allows for filtering by bicycle and dog allowances.

tabs.title: shell
tabs.code:
curl --request GET \
     --url 'https://try.microcks.io/rest/Train+Travel+API/1.0.0/trips?page=1&limit=10&origin=efdbb9d1-02c2-4bc3-afb7-6788d8782b1e&destination=b2e783e1-c824-4d63-b37a-d8d698862f1d&date=2024-02-01T09%3A00%3A00Z&bicycles=false&dogs=false' \
     --header 'accept: application/json'

tabs.title: javascript
python
tabs.code:
import requests

url = "https://try.microcks.io/rest/Train+Travel+API/1.0.0/trips?page=1&limit=10&origin=efdbb9d1-02c2-4bc3-afb7-6788d8782b1e&destination=b2e783e1-c824-4d63-b37a-d8d698862f1d&date=2024-02-01T09%3A00%3A00Z&bicycles=false&dogs=false"

headers = {"accept": "application/json"}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

print(response.text)

tabs.title: go
tabs.code:
package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"net/http"
	"io"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://try.microcks.io/rest/Train+Travel+API/1.0.0/trips?page=1&limit=10&origin=efdbb9d1-02c2-4bc3-afb7-6788d8782b1e&destination=b2e783e1-c824-4d63-b37a-d8d698862f1d&date=2024-02-01T09%3A00%3A00Z&bicycles=false&dogs=false"

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("GET", url, nil)

	req.Header.Add("accept", "application/json")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := io.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

     --url 'https://try.microcks.io/rest/Train+Travel+API/1.0.0/bookings' \

     --data '
{
  "id": "3f3e3e1-c824-4d63-b37a-d8d698862f1d",
  "trip_id": "4f4e4e1-c824-4d63-b37a-d8d698862f1d",

tabs.title: javascript
python
tabs.code:
import requests

url = "https://try.microcks.io/rest/Train+Travel+API/1.0.0/bookings"

payload = {
    "id": "3f3e3e1-c824-4d63-b37a-d8d698862f1d",
    "trip_id": "4f4e4e1-c824-4d63-b37a-d8d698862f1d",
    "passenger_name": "John Doe",
    "has_bicycle": True,
    "has_dog": True
}
headers = {
    "accept": "application/json",
    "content-type": "application/json"
}

response = requests.post(url, json=payload, headers=headers)

print(response.text)

tabs.title: go
tabs.code:
package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"strings"
	"net/http"
	"io"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://try.microcks.io/rest/Train+Travel+API/1.0.0/bookings"

	payload := strings.NewReader("{\"id\":\"3f3e3e1-c824-4d63-b37a-d8d698862f1d\",\"trip_id\":\"4f4e4e1-c824-4d63-b37a-d8d698862f1d\",\"passenger_name\":\"John Doe\",\"has_bicycle\":true,\"has_dog\":true}")

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("POST", url, payload)

	req.Header.Add("accept", "application/json")
	req.Header.Add("content-type", "application/json")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := io.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

tabs.title: go
tabs.code:
package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"net/http"
	"io"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://try.microcks.io/rest/Train+Travel+API/1.0.0/bookings/bookingId"

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("DELETE", url, nil)

	req.Header.Add("accept", "application/problem+json")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := io.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

}
'

tabs.title: go
tabs.code:
package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"strings"
	"net/http"
	"io"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://try.microcks.io/rest/Train+Travel+API/1.0.0/bookings/bookingId/payment"

	payload := strings.NewReader("{\"id\":\"497f6eca-6276-4993-bfeb-53cbbbba6f08\",\"amount\":49.99,\"currency\":\"bam\",\"source\":{\"object\":\"card\",\"name\":\"Francis Bourgeois\",\"number\":\"4242424242424242\",\"cvc\":\"123\",\"exp_month\":12,\"exp_year\":2025,\"address_line1\":\"string\",\"address_line2\":\"string\",\"address_city\":\"string\",\"address_country\":\"string\",\"address_post_code\":\"string\"},\"status\":\"pending\"}")

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("POST", url, payload)

	req.Header.Add("accept", "application/json")
	req.Header.Add("content-type", "application/json")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := io.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for the payment. This will be a unique identifier for the payment, and is used to reference the payment in other objects.

properties.name: amount
properties.description: Amount intended to be collected by this payment. A positive decimal figure describing the amount to be collected.

properties.name: currency
properties.description: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase.

properties.name: source
properties.description: The payment source to take the payment from. This can be a card or a bank account. Some of these properties will be hidden on read to protect PII leaking.

properties.name: Card
properties.description: A card (debit or credit) to take payment from.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Cardholder's full name as it appears on the card.

properties.name: number
properties.description: The card number, as a string without any separators. On read all but the last four digits will be masked for security.

properties.name: cvc
properties.description: Card security code, 3 or 4 digits usually found on the back of the card.

properties.name: exp_month
properties.description: Two-digit number representing the card's expiration month.

properties.name: exp_year
properties.description: Four-digit number representing the card's expiration year.

properties.name: Bank Account
properties.description: A bank account to take payment from. Must be able to make payments in the currency specified in the payment.

properties.name: number
properties.description: The account number for the bank account, in string form. Must be a current account.

properties.name: sort_code
properties.description: The sort code for the bank account, in string form. Must be a six-digit number.

properties.name: account_type
properties.description: The type of entity that holds the account. This can be either `individual` or `company`.

properties.name: bank_name
properties.description: The name of the bank associated with the routing number.

properties.name: country
properties.description: Two-letter country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2).

properties.name: status
properties.description: The status of the payment, one of `pending`, `succeeded`, or `failed`.

properties.name: id

properties.name: amount
properties.description: Amount intended to be collected by this payment. A positive decimal figure describing the amount to be collected.

properties.name: currency
properties.description: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase.

properties.name: source
properties.description: The payment source to take the payment from. This can be a card or a bank account. Some of these properties will be hidden on read to protect PII leaking.

properties.name: Card
properties.description: A card (debit or credit) to take payment from.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Cardholder's full name as it appears on the card.

properties.name: number
properties.description: The card number, as a string without any separators. On read all but the last four digits will be masked for security.

properties.name: cvc
properties.description: Card security code, 3 or 4 digits usually found on the back of the card.

properties.name: exp_month
properties.description: Two-digit number representing the card's expiration month.

properties.name: exp_year
properties.description: Four-digit number representing the card's expiration year.

properties.name: Bank Account
properties.description: A bank account to take payment from. Must be able to make payments in the currency specified in the payment.

properties.name: number
properties.description: The account number for the bank account, in string form. Must be a current account.

properties.name: sort_code
properties.description: The sort code for the bank account, in string form. Must be a six-digit number.

properties.name: account_type
properties.description: The type of entity that holds the account. This can be either `individual` or `company`.

properties.name: bank_name
properties.description: The name of the bank associated with the routing number.

properties.name: country
properties.description: Two-letter country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2).

properties.name: status
properties.description: The status of the payment, one of `pending`, `succeeded`, or `failed`.

properties.name: links
properties.description: The link to the booking resource.

title: Wrapper-Collection
description: This is a generic request/response wrapper which contains both data and links which serve as hypermedia controls (HATEOAS).
